about.title: Get to Know
about.subtitle: Me
about.p1: Hello! I'm Clara Cayres, a Software Engineering student and freelance Web Developer, currently in my 6th semester of college.
about.p2: I currently live in the United States as an au pair, a multicultural experience that strengthened my communication, independence, and adaptability. I will be available for tech opportunities starting July 2026.
about.p3: I have worked on freelance and personal projects, building modern, responsive, and visually appealing websites and web applications. I have experience with HTML, CSS, TailwindCSS, Python, Flask, Django, SQL, MongoDB, and modern web development tools, and I’m constantly improving my Front-End and web design skills.
about.p4: I’m open to job opportunities and collaborations where I can contribute, learn, and grow. If you have an opportunity that aligns with my skills and interests, feel free to get in touch.
about.description: I am a curious web developer focused on continuous learning, creating functional and visually impactful digital experiences by combining development and design.

achievements.title: My
achievements.subtitle: Achievements
achievements.description: Here are some of the courses and certifications I've completed to enhance my skills and knowledge in software development.

card1.title: Learn English Intermediate Grammar
card1.description: A comprehensive course that enhanced my understanding of English grammar at an intermediate level.

card2.title: Beyond the Basics: Advanced Grammar
card2.description: Focused on advanced grammar concepts and their practical applications and conversational skills.

card3.title: IBM Back-End Development Professional Certificate
card3.description: A 11-course certificate from IBM on building scalable back-end apps using Python, Flask, Docker, Kubernetes, and microservices — with hands-on projects and real-world training.

card4.title: HTML, CSS, and Javascript for Web Developers
card4.description: Completed this 4-course specialization mastering web essentials like HTML5, CSS3, responsive design, JavaScript, and AJAX to build dynamic, user-friendly web applications. Achieved perfect scores in most courses, emphasizing strong front-end development skills.

card5.title: Data Structures in Python
card5.description: Completed a 10-hour course covering the fundamentals of data structures using Python. This training strengthened my understanding of core programming logic, object-oriented concepts, and practical problem-solving.

card6.title: Meta Front-End Developer
card6.description: A 9-course specialization from Meta focusing on front-end development using React, JavaScript, and CSS. This program provided hands-on experience in building responsive user interfaces and mastering essential front-end technologies.

card7.title: Web & Mobile Designer: UI/UX and Figma
card7.description: Comprehensive course in UI/UX design for web and mobile, focusing on Figma, prototyping, responsive design, usability, and interface best practices. I am working on practical projects that allow me to apply concepts of typography, colors, grids, and interaction, enhancing my skills in modern digital design.

project2.title: Habitus
project2.description: A responsive landing page created to promote a mobile shopping app. This project was originally inspired by a UI/UX design course, but the HTML and CSS were fully rebuilt from scratch with a focus on clean semantics, responsiveness, and real-world front-end best practices.
